This site can include Jupyter notebooks (`.ipynb`) in two common ways.

1. Render the notebook as a standalone page using Quarto

   - Place notebooks in a `notebooks/` folder (e.g. `notebooks/example.ipynb`).
   - Render it with `quarto render notebooks/example.ipynb` which will produce an HTML page in `_site/` (or the site output folder).
   - Link to the produced HTML from your site navigation or pages.

2. Include notebook content inside a `.qmd` page (convert or execute)

   - You can include the notebook output by converting it to Quarto-compatible content or by embedding the HTML output.
   - Example: in a `.qmd` file you can use an iframe to embed the rendered notebook HTML:

```
<iframe src="notebooks/example.html" style="width:100%;height:800px;border:0"></iframe>
```

Tips:

- Use `quarto render` to convert `.ipynb` to HTML (Quarto will execute notebooks when rendering if execution is enabled).
- Ensure any data or resources used by the notebook are committed or in paths resolvable from the site root.
- If you prefer dynamic execution during site builds, enable `execute: true` in the notebook's YAML or in `_quarto.yml`.

If you want, I can also add a small example `notebooks/example.ipynb` and a build script to automatically render notebooks during site build.
